metadata.title: CVE-2017-12562 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in the psf_binheader_writef function in common.cin libsndfile through 1.0.28 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12562` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsndfile1 - 1.0.25-7ubuntu2.2+esm1
sndfile-programs - 1.0.25-7ubuntu2.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsndfile package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.25-7ubuntu2.2+esm1').
